flaw_data.description: Guide hand positioned on top of ball instead of on side
flaw_data.plain_language: Your guide hand is positioned on top of the ball. Move it to the side for better control and cleaner release.
flaw_data.coaching_tip: Move your guide hand to the side of the ball, not on top. This allows for cleaner release and better ball control.
flaw_data.drill_suggestion: Side placement drill: Practice positioning your guide hand on the side of the ball during form shooting.

detailed_flaws.description: Shooting elbow positioned too far from body
detailed_flaws.plain_language: Your shooting elbow is sticking out too far from your body. This reduces accuracy and consistency.
detailed_flaws.coaching_tip: Keep your shooting elbow directly under the ball. Imagine shooting through a narrow tunnel.
detailed_flaws.drill_suggestion: Wall shooting drill: Stand arm's length from a wall and practice your shooting motion without hitting the wall.

detailed_flaws.description: Guide hand positioned on top of ball instead of on side
detailed_flaws.plain_language: Your guide hand is positioned on top of the ball. Move it to the side for better control and cleaner release.
detailed_flaws.coaching_tip: Move your guide hand to the side of the ball, not on top. This allows for cleaner release and better ball control.
detailed_flaws.drill_suggestion: Side placement drill: Practice positioning your guide hand on the side of the ball during form shooting.

detailed_flaws.description: Advanced analysis detected jerky or rushed shooting motion lacking smooth rhythm
detailed_flaws.remedy_tip: Focus on smooth, rhythmic motion from start to finish. Practice shooting in slow motion to develop muscle memory.
detailed_flaws.exercise_tip: Practice the complete shooting motion without a ball, focusing on fluid movement.
detailed_flaws.plain_language: Your shot motion shows jerky movement (fluidity score: 5.8/100). Work on smoother, more rhythmic motion from start to finish.

feedback_points.user_value: Your shooting elbow is sticking out too far from your body. This reduces accuracy and consistency.
feedback_points.remedy_tips: Keep your shooting elbow directly under the ball. Imagine shooting through a narrow tunnel.
